value.title: AI agents now have their own Reddit-style social network, and it's getting weird fast
value.content: Moltbook lets 32,000 AI bots trade jokes, tips, and complaints about humans.

value.title: Developers say AI coding tools workâ€”and that's precisely what worries them
value.content: Ars spoke to several software devs about AI and found enthusiasm tempered by unease.

value.title: County pays $600,000 to pentesters it arrested for assessing courthouse security
value.content: Settlement comes more than 6 years after Gary DeMercurio and Justin Wynn's ordeal began.

value.title: Does Anthropic believe its AI is conscious, or is that just what it wants Claude to think?
value.content: We have no proof that AI models suffer, but Anthropic acts like they might for training purposes.

value.title: Site catering to online criminals has been seized by the FBI
value.content: One of the last holdouts for ransomware discussions, RAMP is taken down.

value.title: Report: China approves import of high-end Nvidia AI chips after weeks of uncertainty
value.content: Over 400,000 H200 chips coming to tech giants as China tries to balance tech needs with self-reliance.

value.title: Users flock to open source Moltbot for always-on AI, despite major risks
value.content: The open source "Jarvis" chats via WhatsApp but requires access to your files and accounts.

value.title: There's a rash of scam spam coming from a real Microsoft address
value.content: Abusing Microsoft's reputation may make scam harder to spot.

value.title: OpenAI spills technical details about how its AI coding agent works
value.content: Unusually detailed post explains how OpenAI handles the Codex agent loop.

value.title: Why has Microsoft been routing example.com traffic to a company in Japan?
value.content: Company's autodiscover caused users' test credentials to be sent outside Microsoft networks.
